definition: to burn the midnight oil/to work late into the night

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: He sat up far into the night working on the report.
sentences.chinese: 他开夜车至深夜，写那份报告。

sentences.english: He looks sleepy, maybe he stayed up late again yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他看起来很疲倦，可能他昨天又开夜车了。

sentences.english: I'm behind in my work. I will have to stay up all night to meet the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作进度落后了，我得开夜车赶进度了。

sentences.english: It can't help you improve your grades soon to study late every night.
sentences.chinese: 天天开夜车学习并不能帮你快速提高学习成绩。

sentences.english: If you stay up late working every night , your health will surely be affected.
sentences.chinese: 如果你每天开夜车工作，身体必然会受到影响。

sentences.english: If you work hard at other times you won't have to sit up all night before the exam.
sentences.chinese: 你要是平时努力学习，考前就不用整晚开夜车了。

sentences.english: Ever have a project deadline where you need to burn the midnight oil to get the work done?
sentences.chinese: 有没有一个项目到了截止日期，你需要开夜车完成？

definition: to stay up late or all night
an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
